alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 10:03PM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties. For the Passaic River...including Singac...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield begins to flood. Finns Drive, Siesta Drive, and Market street in Wayne are all susceptible to flooding. William Street, Louis Street, and Zeliff Avenue in Little Falls can begin to flood. Portions of Lincoln Park become impassable. The Meadows Golf Club in Lincoln Park floods. At 11.0 feet, Little Falls Road in Fairfield floods. Flooding increases across the Singac section of Little Falls. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EST Friday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below moderate flood stage this evening. The river will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning and continue falling to 7.8 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 10.0 Fri 9 pm 8.9 8.3 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1045 AM EST.
